data.title: Hikaru Utadaâ€™s â€˜First Loveâ€™ Netflix Series Is Coming, Plus a 2022 Vinyl
data.meta_description: The Hikki-inspired series arrives this fall, along with a very special â€œFirst Loveâ€ / â€œHatsukoiâ€ vinyl.
data.text:
After dropping BAD Mode at the top of the year, performing at Coachella, teaming up with Cartier and, most recently, singing â€œSomewhere Near Marseillesâ€ to sharks while clubbing in an aquarium â€“ a scene plucked straight from my personal fan-fiction â€“ Hikaru Utada has even more for us to get excited about this fall.

As previously announced, thereâ€™s a Yuri Kanchiku-directed Netflix series coming, called First Love, inspired by none other than Hikaruâ€™s massively popular, instant ugly cry-inducing 1999 single from their record-shattering Japanese debut studio album, as well as 2018â€™s â€œHatsukoi.â€

Two years later, itâ€™s finally readyâ€¦and itâ€™s premiering on November 24.

As of Friday (September 23), thereâ€™s now an official page for the series on Netflix, as well as the first teaser poster, and an official description.

Per Netflix: â€œA cross-generational love story inspired by â€œFirst Loveâ€ (1999) and â€œHatsukoiâ€ (2018), two seminal songs by Hikaru Utada. Two teenagers fall in love for the first time in the late 90s; two decades later, one is about to get engaged, while the other is divorced with a teenage son whoâ€™s falling in love for the first time.â€

The show is categorized on Netflix as â€œswoonworthy,â€ â€œheartfeltâ€ and â€œfeel-good.â€ Also: TV-MA rating. Hello! Letâ€™s celebrate that!

The cast includes Takeru Satoh, star of the Rurouni Kenshin film series, and Hikari Mitsushima, the idol singer-turned-actress who starred in 2006â€™s Death Note adaptation, and more recently performed and danced in Mondo Grossoâ€˜s â€œLabyrinth,â€ a 2017 highlight!), as well as lending her captivating voice to this yearâ€™s â€œIn This World.â€

The first teaser from the show will be unveiled at TUDUM Japan, Netflixâ€™s global fan event on September 25.

But the news doesnâ€™t stop with the show.

Thatâ€™s right: on December 9, the 24th anniversary of Hikkiâ€™s debut, Hikaru Utada will release Dolby Atmos versions of the two songs: â€œFirst Love (2022 Mix),â€ as well as â€œHatsukoi (2022 Remastering),â€ plus a limited edition 7-inch vinyl â€œFirst Love / Hatsukoiâ€ containing the two tracks, as well as a cappella versions.

The track was mixed by engineer Steve Fitzmaurice, whoâ€™s worked with Hikaru since FantÃ´me.

â€œThe meticulously designed three-dimensional acoustics bring a new and fascinating experience. The analog version of â€˜First Love (2022 Mix)â€™ is newly mixed by the same engineer and â€˜First Love (2022 Remastering)â€™ is done specially for this,â€ the official website declares.

And yes, the â€œFirst Loveâ€ / â€œHatsukoiâ€ 7â€³ vinyl is available to pre-order right now. (Thereâ€™s an External Bonus item for the limited press, intriguingly listed as â€œa coaster.â€)

This is all very thrilling, and potentially massive: weâ€™ve all seen how international TV shows on Netflix have become global events in the past few years. The idea of Hikaru Utadaâ€™s classics taking on new life and reaching new ears is incredibly exciting. Plus, crisp new versions of â€œFirst Loveâ€ and â€œHatsukoiâ€ â€“ and a collectible item to boot, just in time for Christmas. The Hikki Hive is nothing if not thoroughly being fed in 2022.

We will be streamingâ€¦the show and the music. Watch party with Kuma-chan?
